meanings.definition: Having lived or existed for a greater length of time.
meanings.sent1: My grandma is older than my little brother.
meanings.sent2: The oak tree in the park is older than the playground equipment.
meanings.sent3: The antique clock on the shelf looks older than time itself.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom made her seem older than her years.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stood as a testament to the older civilizations.

meanings.definition: Of a greater age than someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The senior cat is older than the kitten.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins are older than the modern city.
meanings.sent3: The dusty book in the library is older than the librarian.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl seemed older than the forest itself.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out map showed the older routes through the land.

meanings.definition: More advanced in years or age.
meanings.sent1: The older students helped the younger ones with their homework.
meanings.sent2: The older members of the family shared stories of the past.
meanings.sent3: The wrinkled dog looked older than his playful behavior suggested.
meanings.sent4: The ancient tree in the forest seemed older than time itself.
meanings.sent5: The fading photograph captured the older days of laughter and joy.
